biography.value:
Professors of growth nurture the essence of nature through their magic. They brew infusions of plants, fungi, and insects or other minuscule creatures that thrum with the essence of life, using these infusions to fuel their magic instead of using traditional material components. In battle, they flood their allies with vital essence, healing wounds and soothing ailments. Their foes face the wrath of nature itself, from grasping plants and conjured poisonous vines to avatars of natureâ€™s wrath.

These professors teach their students to focus on the growth side of the natural cycle of life and death and to avoid wasting resources. They espouse the philosophy that a thriving system benefits all.

Witherbloom Scholars

Witherbloom College studies the magic inherent in the natural cycle of life and death. Witherbloom professors approach the philosophy from different directions, with one methodology focusing on decay and the other dealing with growth.

description.value: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts.

The professor makes two Verdant Lash attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=poison average=true]] damage, and the target must succeed on a [[/save str 15 format=long]] or be pulled up to 10 feet closer to the professor.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} as the spellcasting ability:

At will: druidcraft, spare the dying

1/day each: greater restoration, lesser restoration, mass cure wounds, pass without trace, &Reference[plant]{plant} growth, revivify

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The professor magically summons a Groff. The groff appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the professor, acts as the professorâ€™s ally, and takes its turns immediately after the professorâ€™s. The professor can communicate telepathically with this groff while it remains. The groff remains for 10 minutes, until it or the professor dies, or until the professor dismisses it as an action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Summon Natureâ€™s Avatar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Summon Natureâ€™s Avatar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).

description.value:
Whispering to the spirits of &Reference[nat]{nature}, you create one of the following effects within range:

  • You create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
  • You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.
  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, a puff of wind, the sound of a small animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}.
  • You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs.

You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's &Reference[exhaustion]{exhaustion} level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

  • One effect that &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[petrified]{petrified} the target
  • One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item
  • Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
  • One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be &Reference[blinded]{blinded}, &Reference[deafened]{deafened}, &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed}, or &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}.

A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs.

At Higher Levels.Â When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. There are two possible uses for the spell, granting either immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

If you cast this spell over 8 hours, you enrich the land. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 1 year. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

system.chatFlavor: [healing] Target creature that has died within the last minute
